title: DEAR DEBBIE
author: Freida McFadden
description: An advice columnist who is having trouble at work and home decides to get back at people she thinks deserve it.

title: THEO OF GOLDEN
author: Allen Levi
description: A man travels to a small Southern town, where he purchases pencil drawings of local residents and exchanges them for stories.

title: THE CORRESPONDENT
author: Virginia Evans
description: Letters from someone she used to know push Sybil Van Antwerp toward revisiting her past and finding a way to forgive.

title: HEATED RIVALRY
author: Rachel Reid
description: The second book in the Game Changers series. Rival captains of two hockey teams try to keep their relationship out of the spotlight.

title: PENDERGAST: THE BEGINNING
author: Douglas Preston and Lincoln Child
description: Agent Pendergast’s ghastly first case involves a suspension and ritualistic killings.

title: THE INVISIBLE COUP
author: Peter Schweizer
description: The author of “Blood Money” puts forward his argument that mass migration is a political weapon.

title: STRANGERS
author: Belle Burden
description: Burden retraces her marriage of 20 years in search of clues to help shape her understanding about its demise and to find a way forward.

title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: Bessel van der Kolk
description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

title: WHERE WE KEEP THE LIGHT
author: Josh Shapiro with Emily Jane Fox
description: The governor of Pennsylvania chronicles events that shaped his life and his political career.

author: Andrew Ross Sorkin
description: The New York Times journalist and CNBC host looks at the fight between Washington and Wall Street that fueled a historic crash of the stock market.

title: STOP, IN THE NAME OF GOD
author: Charlie Kirk

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: GROWING HOME
author: Beth Ferry. Illustrated Terry Fan and Eric Fan
description: Talking plants, a grumpy goldfish and an inquisitive spider save the Tupper family from utter ruin. (Ages 6 to 9)

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: THE COURT OF THE DEAD
author: Rick Riordan and Mark Oshiro
description: Nico, Will and Hazel delve into the mysterious disappearances of monsters at Camp Jupiter. (Ages 10 to 14)

title: POCKET BEAR
author: Katherine Applegate. Illustrated Charles Santoso
description: Zephyrina brings a rare stuffed bear back to the Second Chances Home for the Tossed and Treasured. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: LITTLE BLUE TRUCK'S VALENTINE
author: Alice Schertle. Illustrated Jill McElmurry
description: Little Blue Truck delivers Valentine's Day cards to all his farm animal friends. (Ages 4 and up)

title: HOW TO CATCH A LOVEOSAURUS
author: Alice Walstead. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: The Catch Club Kids attempt to catch a dinosaur that wants to spread love and kindness. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: FOR THE FANS!
author: Angela Song
description: Meet the members of the K-pop group Huntrix. (Ages 2 to 5)

title: GRUMPY MONKEY VALENTINE GROSS-OUT
author: Suzanne Lang. Illustrated Max Lang
description: Jim Panzee believes that Valentine's Day is gross, especially kissing! (Ages 4 to 8)

title: LOVE FROM THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: Eric Carle
description: A ravenous insect returns with its appetite intact. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: Jeff Kinney. Illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: PERCY JACKSON & THE OLYMPIANS
author: Rick Riordan
description: A boy battles mythological monsters. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: THE POWERLESS TRILOGY
author: Lauren Roberts
description: A story of forbidden love between Paedyn, an Ordinary, and Kai, an Elite, in the kingdom of Ilya. (Ages 14 and up)

title: FAKE SKATING
author: Lynn Painter
description: After years of separation, the childhood friends Alec and Dani reunite and face their true feelings toward each other. (Ages 14 and up)

title: IF ONLY I HAD TOLD HER
author: Laura Nowlin
description: In this companion to “If He Had Been With Me,” the story of Finn and Autumn is told through three different perspectives. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: DRAGON CURSED
author: Elise Kova
description: At age 18 in the city of Vinguard, humans are brought before the Tribunal to determine if they are dragon cursed. (Ages 16 to 17)

title: WINGS OF STARLIGHT
author: Allison Saft
description: Clarion, the successor to the throne of Pixie Hollow, is determined to confront a monster that threatens the land. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: BETTER THAN THE MOVIES
author: Lynn Painter
description: Hopeless romantic Liz has a crush on Michael but finds out that she likes being around her neighbor Wes. (Ages 12 and up)
